text: Can from AJs Beer Warehouse. Aroma is mostly floral hops I guess. No noticeable malt in my opinion.
Piwo skonsumowane. Ocena na podstawie retrospekcji w celu uzupełnienia profilu.

Can from notes. Pours a hazy orange golden color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have pale malts, cereal, citrus hops, grass, dry, light body but the flavor makes it seem bigger, decent.
Pours a hazy gold with a thick white head. Strong aroma of citrus and hops. Taste is bitter citrus water. This beer makes me glad I like alcohol.

Can. Batch 014, probably old. Pours clear golden honey, white head. Aroma is light citrus, pils malt, caramel malt, orange. Mostly malty. Wow, that flavor. This is basically seltzer with some citrus bitterness in the end. Biscuit malt, kinda sweet maltiness. I dont really know what to say about this. Its a low alcohol beer. It was never going to be amazing. Its like a jr. coors light with citrus. Refreshing. They say 2.7% but it drinks like 3.2%.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Isotonic beer :)

355ml can. Pours a clear golden colour with a thin white head, lots of fine sediment suspended in the beer. Aroma: light citrus/tropical hops, floral. Taste: citrus/tropical fruit, light sweet and mild bitter. Light body but decent carbonation so not too watery. Very easy drinking and a lot of flavour for such a low alcohol beer. Good stuff.

1 finger golden hbeer. Smells like a very light session ale with american hops and some oats. Flavor is so simple and almost medicinal. You get a sharp malt that thins out and the hops fade and youre left with sweet water.
Bottle from the importer. dry and fresh, nice sensations and high carbonation.
Poured from the can with a light yellow/straw-like color. Light piney and fruity aroma. Good hop flavor. Tastes like youre drinking a bigger beer than it is. Extremely sessionable.

Backlog. Old review 
Nicely hoppy and fruity. Extremely light bodied yet not watery due to the carbonation. I would drink it anytime - its drinkable taken to its limits.
Can at home. Explosive! Clear gold, bubbly white cream head. Hoppy freshness, orange, lime, pine, buttescotch, cream. Light body, quenching, herbaceous bitterness and zesty citruses, lime peel.
Gold pour with quickly diminishing head hoppy fanta taste with a mild bitterness from the hops good for the abv.
Hoppy and fruity. Hazy golden orange with fluffy white head. Floral hops aroma. Very drinkable.
Can @ home. Aroma of citrus, piney hops. Light hazy with white head, mostly diminishing. Taste is moderate bitter and light sweet to dry. Light body, dry feel and light bitter finish.
Can. Very hoppy compared to the low abv. Nice rounded taste. High notes of hops and sleek finish
Can from Real Ale Store. Newark. Golden colour with a thin white head. Aroma has light soft fruit, melon and grapefruit. Taste fruity light sweet. Think she hody.
Can. Nose: pine, grass, pineapple. Taste: thin, piny, slightly floral hops. Sessionable! Surprisingly much taste and body for such a low alc beer.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2016 Can. Nose is soft pineapple, melon, hint of white grape, sweet. Taste lemon. Thin grapefruit, hint of resin, dry bitter finish. Thin Mouthfeel. Its a nice low alcohol beer that would go well over lunch on a hot day
Pale pour, huge white head. Aroma of grass, wheat, some hops. Its medium bodied with a decent amount of flavor. Light, sweet, candy-like finish. Too bad there isnt more alcohol.

Fruity aroma. The taste is also fruity and slightly bitter. Very bitter aftertaste that fills the mouth for a long time. Good but too bitter. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Pours a pale golden color with a foamy white head. Notes of sweet cereal, flowers, and citrus. A bit thin but shockingly rounded out for how low the alcohol is. Bit of tang on the back end.
Pours slightly hazy golden yellow with frothy white head. Nice smooth hoppy aroma. Taste is light malty and bitter. Super light bodied, lively carbonation, refreshing.

Pale golden, visible carbonation and a fading white puff of a head. Nose is clammy citrus, coppery and soft spice. Initial taste is pretty crisp pineapple and guava and lightly sweet. Fairly timid carbonation and well sanctioned clean lift to the mouthfeel. Finishes kinda creamy kinda sweet, nice balance before a pine linger and coppery dryness. Drinkability is superb, just about enough flavour to cap that off - although on price point perhaps not quite the same as some UK alternatives.Can, Bottle Baron

Can from Bottle Baron. Hazy golden body with tiny yeast flecks floating beneath a thin white head that fades. Low carbonation. No lacing. Aroma of tonic water and Skittles. Flavour of grain, lemon and steel. Thin body with a watery texture. Soft fizz. Theres not much to it, but whats there is good.

Can. Cotteridge. Clear gold, with lots of floaters. Skim of white head. Nose has faded hops. Some sweet cracker malts. Notes of grapefruit. Taste is light bitter, with some dryness. Light bodied. Crisp fizz. Short, dry and bitter finish.

Light orangey-golden with a white head, average lacings. Aromas of straw, lemon, grapefruit and spruce develop all rather subtle. Fine carbonation, thin texture with a light body. Briskly sweet with a well balanced hop bitterness. Short bit dry finish. Quaffer.

Can. Pours golden with a white frothy head that dies quite quickly. Aroma is quite sweet, honey. Also citrus fruit and herbs. Light body, but not watery. Medium carbonation. Quite abrupt, and what finish there is, is mostly bitter. Flavour is mostly malty bitterness. Quite nice.

330ml can from boxbeers.dk. Pours slightly hazy golden yellow with a white lasting head. Pineapple, hints of other tropical fruits in the aroma. Pineapple, hints of other fruits at first. Crisp, slightly watery, slightly bitter in the middle. Slight bitterness and hints of citrusses in the end. Light bodied. High carbonation. Quite ok!

Can from Cotteridge Wines; hazy golden yellow pour with a creamy off white head, aroma has a hint of pine and some citrus, taste has really bitter grapefruit, pineapple, packs in big flavour into a tiny ABV.
12oz can from Beer52.com. A slightly hazy amber pour with a billowing white head; tropical fruit aroma; thin body with a citrusy taste; and a tart finish. Certainly refreshes the taste buds.
12 oz. can from Spirit World. Poured golden, frothy white head. Aroma was citrus, pine. Taste was slight bitter, lingering bitter aftertaste.
Can. Clear golden pour with white head. Aroma has citrus and peach. Taste is mild and balanced with light bitterness. Light body

33cl bottle at home from Biernavigatie.nl. Nose is wheat malty, light citric. Body is clear to hazy straw yellow, head is very big, white, fizzy, mostly diminishing, fair lacing. Aroma is malty, quinine, tonic water, light citric. Medium sweet, heavy bitter. Finish is long lasting hoppy heavy bitter. Light body, thin texture, fizzy carbonation. Easy, refreshing bitter summer beer, nice one.
From Whole Foods PM. Hazy straw pour with off-white head. Floral hops in the nose, pale malt, more grainy flavor in the taste, decent hop bill, florals, black peppery spiciness. Solid

This pours a hazy golden amber color with a frothy white head. It has a mild earthy, hoppy aroma. The taste has pineapple, citrus, but a really awkward bitterness to it. Might be due somewhat to the age, the can was packaged 2 years ago so Im betting this one didnt hold up well. But if this is the ay it is suppose to taste, no thanks.

Can - 355ml. Beautiful golden body with lively carbonation and a thick, lasting, white frothy head. Good malty/hoppy aroma with herbal, grainy, and citrusy hints. Its fresh, sharp hoppy taste carries herbal and citrusy notes. Ends with a dry, herbal finish. Good stuff.

Slightly hazy gold with a hugh frothy head. Aroma has a lot of pine and pineapple, and some flowery notes, nice and lively. Taste light and bitter, with the kind of finish youd expect from an ipa. Very lively carbonation. Good ipa

330ml can. Slightly hazy golden yellow colour. Modest white head which stays. Pineapple, hints of other tropical fruits in the aroma. Pineapple, hints of other fruits at first. Crisp, slightly watery, slightly bitter in the middle. Slight bitterness and hints of citrusses in the end. Light bodied. High carbonation. Quite simple, reasonable drinking beer.

330ml can. Slightly hazy golden color. Medium size, bubbly and fluffy white head, stays. Nettles, herbal, plastic, sweet in aroma. Sourish, stemmy, twiggy, straw, citrus in taste. This whole thing is diluted down to zero. Shame. But since Im on my way to recovery- forgiven. Still soulless brew.

This canned brew from a bottle shop poured a extremely large sized head of foamy finely sized white colored bubbles that were long lasting and left behind a strong bubbly carbonation transparent yellow colored body and a thick foamy lacing. The weak aroma was lagerish. The bubbly mouth feel was very tingly at the start and at the finish with a bubbly hoppy aftertaste. The bubbly flavor contained notes of mild lager cardboard mild hops and grass. A horrible one that I would rather not drink again.
UPDATED: MAY 29, 2016 Can. Pours golden. Aroma is sweet, fruity, pineapple, fruits. Flavor is sweet and fruity, pineapple, tangerines. Overall: good.

Bready seltzer hop. Thought it was a bit bland but didnt know it was such a low abv until reading the can. I guess thats a good thing. A bit thin.... In the sun maybe

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can. Pours a sunny unfiltered bright gold. Nose is delicate floral and zested citrus skin, a little bit of bready malt. Flavor is bright, rindy and very floral, with a modest malt presence. A tiny bit seltzer-y. Its like drinking a cheapy, except made with the proper ingredients! Only downside...11.99 for a sixer? Cmon guys....

Can to glass. Pour is rich gold in color with a medium to large white head. Lots of particulate matter floating. Aroma is a zing of floral hops with light pepper and faint biscuit malt. Flavor is also spicy with floral hop and a touch of malty sweetness. Lots of flavor. Never would have guess low abv.

Laranja vivo,leve turbidez,espuma branca abundante irregular de média persistência. Aroma tem bastante cítrico,laranja, frutas amarelas de baixo dulçor, leve fermento. Paladar de baixo amargor e dulçor, achei que poderia ser mais intenso, mas aliado ao corpo leve e média carbonatação, tem boa drinkability. Final mantém o cítrico, de breve duração.
Can. Hazy golden. Aroma: fruity, citrus. Taste: juicy fruit, citrus, mild hop bitterness.

Shared 12 oz. can. Clear straw and clear, with a large fluffy and initially fizzy white head that has good retention. Aroma is fruity with plenty of citrus and pine. Taste is citrus, floral notes, light pine, and pale malts. Its surprisingly flavorful for such a low ABV. High carbonation. Light-bodied and refreshing. Nice.

Aroma: hoppy and fruity with slight foreign note; Appearance: hazy golden orange with fluffy white head; Taste: starts and finishes with a nice, floral hops flavor; unexpectedly good; Palate: light bodied with fluffy white head; Overall: would definitely try again as a session ipa or apa.
Pours a nice light golden yellow. Aromas of hops, grass, and maybe malt. Taste is crisp with a nice mellow hop flavor.

Can from Biervana. Orange color with big white head. Aroma is big piney and citrusy hops. Taste is piney, with a shy grainy body typical for low-ABV beers. Some other undefinable fruity elements are there as well, as well as some spicy flavours. It also tastes a bit milky, maybe from the yeast? Mouthfeel is light and a bit foamy, carbonation is high. Bitter finish. Overall refreshing and good, but still very noticeably low ABV, but that shouldnt be held against this beer - its really a good low ABV option!
Pale gold color. Biscuit and citrus aroma. Big bitter piney hop bite. Lots of flavor for low alcohol. Alright!

Aroma is bitter, earthy hops, light sweetness, not much happening as expected. Appearance is dark straw yellow, off white head, hazy. Taste is bitter, mostly, earthy, slight citrus. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, crisp carbonation, bitter aftertaste. Overall, this has a lot of flavor for the low alcohol.
Clear orange body with a medium white head. Aroma is medium malty medium hoppy, pine, peach. Taste is medium sweet and medium to heavy bitter. Average carbonation, light body, bitter finish.

This was poured into a pint glass.
The appearance was a semi-hazy to somewhat burnt orange and ruddy transparency about it. Carbonation could be seen rising at a moderate pace.
The smell had some burnt graininess along with some cereal notes and a light lemon all around.
The taste was moderately sweet with a dry bitterness coming across pretty tight on my tongue. Grainy aftertaste runs into the finish.
On the palate, this one sat extremely light on the body with a clingy sharp bitterness in the back of the throat.
Overall, low alcohol or session IPA, hell if I know, but cant really see myself coming back to this.
Pours a pale golden color with a white head. Citrus, floral and cracker aroma and flavors. Light body and medium carbonation. Citrus finish.
(can) clear, bright yellow colour with a tall white head; aroma of citrus, then cake; light, dry flavour with a long, light bitter finish

355 ml. can on the train. Purchased @ Malt Attacks. Drank straight from the can. Nose is big milky hop, lemon, basic, lightly floral, lemon peel & hay. Chewy milky hop & yeast body. Rather thick with lemon, hop, milky yeast, some floral notes, basil, hay, sugar, thyme, passionfruit. Drinks surprisingly well & works surprisingly well. Nice low ABV beer / low ABV IPA.

Can
Orange clear, white head heavy
Aroma peach and snuf
Taste bitter ipa, flat, thin.

Can, 0,355l. Cloudy deep golden color with large frothy white head and sparkling appearance. Aroma of passion fruit, grapefruit, cereals and herbs. Taste starts light sweet grainy, following is refreshing citric with dry and mild spicy mouth feel and moderate bitter finish. Light body, thin texture and average carbonation in palate. A bit sissy, but still very decent low alcohol ale...
Can. Clear orange body. Citrus and pine hop aroma and flavour, light body, dry bitter finish

2013 bottle: Pencil shavings, caramel, grass nose. Hazy amber, large floating chunks, thick head, good lace. Dry, very astringent, cardboard and pencil shavings. Light body, moderate carbonation. Full of flavor for a low alcohol beer, but there is advanced oxidation. Must re-rate a fresher bottle.
Can at home. Aroma is grassy, citrus, some grapefruit, hint of grain, some peach, hops. Flavour is moderate bitter. Body is light. An excellent thirst quenching hoppy low alcohol beer.

Light crisp citrus aroma. Pale yellow body with a faint haziness. The head is overwhelming at first and takes quite awhile to get down to enough to finially drink it. Light bitterness with a modest grapefruit taste. Thin bodied. Not much going. Like a session IPA but even lower.

Can from Le petit L′ouest in Shimokitazawa. Drank straight from the can. Citrus on the nose at first which dissipates fairly quickly. Pretty watery and thin on the palate but has some light citrus flavors along with grass and pith. Bitter finish, but not overly so. Pilsner malt like. Not bad, but a little underwhelming.
Can from hop hideout, Sheffield. Bright orange with small white head. Aroma is hoppy and fruity with peach and pine. Taste is Ingy and bitter, refreshing. Prickly and medium. Impressive la beer.

Pours a pale, slightly hazy light golden yellow color with a half finger white head that quickly settles. Minimal spotty lacing left behind. 

Slightly floral, earthy hop aroma with a subtle malt backbone. Very bland with not much else going on. 

Light bodied with a subtle crisp hop presence countered by pale malt and subtle fruit notes. Slightly crisp and bitter with some resinous pine and light fruit flavor. Pale malt, bread and cracker underneath but this bee is very watered down and boring. Just some one dimensional hop flavor and a faint pale malt backbone. Not very interesting.
33cl can from beergium. Gold to orange color. Thin head. Taste is medium bitter, light sweet. Aroma is pineapple, passionfruit, hop.
golden with a small white head. light grape, medium bitter, light bodied with a lively carbonation.

1 Nov 2015, can. light gold, clear, steady bubbles. nose is crisp, thin, lemon rind. thin body and mildly fizzy. lemon pith and slightly floral. it is very muted. thin lemon, thin body. its beer but obviously it is very low in alcohol.

Aroma and taste is light fruity hoppy, with notes of satsuma, lemon, some peachy notes, light body as expected but packs allot of taste for the abv. Nice.

---Sent via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours a clear golden with a big, soapy white head. Aroma has hops, slight soap, pineapple, subtle orangy sweetness. Taste is light, slight pale malts, some smooth sweetness, slight bitter finish. Average carbonation and a very light body. Not too bad for the ABV!

Backlog rating. Keg at Mother Kellys, London. It pours a clean pale golden color with small white head. Aroma is light grains, grass, some starch and melon. Taste has light pine, grass and grains. Light bodied with good carbonation. Overall, decent

Pours clear golden with low white head
Aromas malty, hints of citrus, herbal
Taste has grassy hops, malty backbone, citrus, bready
Quite ok low alcohol. No ups or downs
Good hops smell, light and fruity, taste is much poorer though...quite hoppy and like tonic water in bitterness....very much like tonic actually...thats all its got...

appearance: medium gold, absolutely chock full of floaties, short-lived white-to-yellow head. aroma: 	resinous, melony, citrus hops, hint of white bread. taste: muddy cardboard, stale passion fruit, light pineapple, pine. finish: short, slightly sweet, a bit citrusy. notes: This beer is bullshit. Allegedly fresh can from TW&M in Alexandria, VA.
12oz can. Golden color with one finger fluffy head. Citrus, melon, slight pine aroma. I wouldnt think this is under 3%. Some decent flavor of citrus and bitter pine. Very easy to drink.
Can shared at a tasting at Maxs place. Thanks trapped. Hazy gold with a white head. Hop oil and pine aroma. Hop juice bitterness, citrus undertones in the mouth. Light body, fizzy, hoppy finish.

Pours two fingers of head on a clear light straw body.
The aroma is fruity and light: lemon, grapefruit and melon. Nice.
The taste has an assertive and bold bitterness up front, that tampers down a little towards the end. 
The texture is crisp.
The flavor is a bit unbalance, too much bitterness.
Tap at Sidedoor. Filtered orange-tan body. Foamy steady white head. Classic beer-beer. Crisp. Really nice balance between the noble hops and golden malt. Doesnt come off thin for the low ABV.
found in a fridge. Thought Id see what its about. Now i get it... Not sure why anyone would drink this
Hoppiest low ABV beer Ive ever had. Loving the bitter taste all the way through from aroma to finish. Less citrus notes than regular IPAs, but is super drinkable.

The beer is golden with a medium white head, and it has so much sediment floating throughout. The beer has a pine and citrus aroma, and the taste is quite bitter and slightly sweet with the hop bitterness hitting the tongue first and only fading slightly through the aftertaste. The palate fuses a slick and thin texture, light body, and a soft carbonation.
Can. Pours golden with a small white head. Aroma of pine, citrus, grass and mild fruit. Flavor was sweet and bitter with caramel, pine, grapefruit, citrus and light fruit.

Can to pint glass. Pale yellow pour, about a finger of firm head that leaves no lacing to speak of. Aroma is a little stronger than expected - floral hops, tropical fruit, a little pine resin. All of that comes through in the flavor as well. About as flavorful as a low alcohol/micro is going to get. Light, crisp, cider-like body and mouthfeel with lively carbonation.

This is far better tasting beer than Id have expected, given that theres just nothing in the can. It pours light yellow, heavy carbonation, fairly foamy head. The aroma is a little like sweet cornbread, there is some citrus hop in the smell, too. The flavor is dry, which is just amazing for a 2.7% ABV beer. There are noticeable pine hops, too. The finish is as clean as pure water, but the fact that there is anything at all to taste in this thing amazes me.

Aroma: citrus, spruce, cereal, 
Appearance: clear gold, white head
Taste: light sweetness, lightly bitter, 
Palate: light body, slick feel, soft carbonation, abrupt finish

Decent

Rating #1133 - 355ml Can from CBI. Killer tropical punch bowl nose erupting from this foaming straw-coloured pour. Cool mango, citrusy hoppy overtones pronounced into a balanced straw maltiness, with a crisp dry finish. This much flavour packed into 2.7% is just unreal. Gotta get it.

Can from Craftbros in Seoul. It pours a fairly clear gold and a soapy head of head. The nose is really great with a wonderful fruity hoppiness I enjoy. Med-light bodied with a fairly smooth mouthfeel but it seems somewhat undercarbed. The taste is incredibly bitter with a green pine hoppiness and a mouth-puckering chalky grapefruit rind aftertaste. Too bitter for me and the flavors are not at all in the same vein as the enticing aroma. A bit of a let down but for a 2.7% beer fairly good.
Golden color with a huge foamy white head. Very light and a bit thin. Wheat and very dry hops. Slightly bitter, long finish.
Draught at Leijuva Lahna. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, hops, peach, malts and grass. Bitter finish with hops, citrus, grass and resin. Very nice brew.

Can. Head is initially small, frothy, white, mostly diminishing. Body is medium yellow. Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), moderately hoppy (flowers, apricot), with light notes of cantaloupe and detergent. Flavor is lightly sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly to moderately acidic, lightly to moderately bitter. Light body, watery texture, lively carbonation.

Not too bad all things considered, but pretty tough to truly enjoy. Very stark, thin, watery, and with almost not sugars left. So its basically a bitter hop tonic, and the hops are just the usual grapefruit-resin variety so its not a lot of fun to sniff.
Doubt this was fresh, but I have to rate as I had it. Got it at a pub in Reno. Tasted stale with stinky hops, floaties, and a thin body. Nothing grabbed my attention. Didnt finish.
Can from k-market, kamppi. Hazy deep golden color, white head. Aroma is nicely hoppy and fruity. Light malty body and fruity hoppy finish.

Nice aroma of pineapple and pine. Light yellow with an almost whipped cream textured white head. The aroma is deceiving and this is a very light bodied beer. Good dry hay and pine bitterness and just enough biscuity malt sweetness to balance it out. This is the best light beer Ive ever had!
Nice beer for a long and warm day at the beach. Light, clean and drinkable. With 2.7 ABV, thumbs up for the effort E.T.!

Bottle purchased at 7/11, Kittery, ME. Yeah, I cant lie, I bought this for the tick. But it really turned out better than I was guessing it would. Aroma is mild fruit, light grass and weak malt. 
The body is light (as anyone would guess) but it does have a nice crispness. The bitterness is bold with a big hop profile considering the gravity of the brew. Im going to rate to style on this one and half to say I maybe hard pressed to find. 2.7% beer with this much flavor.

12 oz. can from Total Wine, Virginia Beach, VA. Yellowish-orange pour with a frothy white head. Nice aroma of pineapple, tangerine, and light pine. Brief bitter hop taste of pine resin and lemon zest with an equal amount of caramel malt. Very impressive at only 2.7% ABV and pretty tasty too.
Must be the best low alc Ive tasted so far. Delicious hoppy aroma and flavour with piney notes.

A nice low alc brew. Pours a bright glowing yellow and orange with a thin hop laced head. The aroma is hoppy and pure with lemon zest and juicy resins and grapefruit. Nice and easy sipping brew with a good hop content. Very refreshing.

12 oz can pours a hazy golden color with a small white head. Aromas of light citrus, grapefruit, light hay. Blight bodied, easy drinking.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12oz can to mouth. Poured a little in a glass. Golden yellow. Turbid. Well hopped. Surprisingly tasty.

Wow, I like other Evil Twin beers quite well, but this just doesnt do anything for me at all. From bottle, pours a hazy orange yellow with lots and lots of floaters and a thin white head that leaves some lacing on the glass. Weak aroma of citrus with caramel. Taste is weakly bitter, barely citrus fruity. No sweetness, Extra thin mouthfeel.

I like big beers, and this one is tiny. I know Im not the audience for this, but I enjoy trying everything, and this one just misses the mark completely. I would try it again. Maybe my taster is just off tonight.

12oz can, slight hazy honey gold hue, with a thick bubbly pillowy white head, with a light candied orange, tangerine peel, subtle candyish orange lollipop nose, with a faint lemon marmalade, light herbal floral leafy, grassy, piney, cedary, citrus hoppy accent, and a subtle lemon pie crust, pale, pilsener, caramunich malt note in the aroma follows through on a light-bodied palate with a nice watery, flowery leafy, grassy, piney, citrus hoppy, cedar bush, pine bark, faint orange peel, zest lemon, grapefruit rind character, with some lemon marmalade, lemon pie crust, mint Leaf, faint hop pellet, resinous flavours, leading towards a fruity lemon, grapefruit rind, good lingering leafy, grassy, resiny, piney, cedary, citrus hop bitterness finish.

Shared bottle at an early, St. Pats party, I believe a bomber, poured to a fest glass, displaying a cloudy, orangey straw color, with a light, soft white film, and minimal lacing. The nose was initially light yeast, grain, & greenery, with both aroma & taste sharing a combination of dryness, citrusy tartness, & bitterness. Light bodied, with carbonation that was rather lively & spritzy. No buzz expected, but a nice, palate refresher for the heavy brews to follow.
Almost year old can. Bit hazy yellow to orange color with medium head. Aroma is fruity, citrus, hops. Flavor is fruity, grapefruit, pine, bitter finnish. Refreshing after 3km swim.

BOD 10/23/14. Pours a slightly cloudy almost medium amber (slightly darker than golden). Normal head volume, lacing and somewhat poor retention.

Nice complex nose of citric (grapefruit, tangerine and orange) hops and biscuit with a touch of caramel and a note of pepper spice.

Almost light medium body with a nice smooth texture. Above normal carbonation with a nice effervescent rush from the middle on.

The outstanding flavor profile is intense in hop flavor, with a degree of complexity and very well balanced - especially for a 2.9% ABV beer. It begins with a blended hop flavor that flows into a mild rind/pine bitterness in the middle. As the edge comes off the bitterness, a mild biscuit sweetness comes forward providing balance. The finish as slightly dry and is a slow fade of rind flavored bitterness.

Great nice fresh fruity nose. Citrus grapefruit, some floralness, earthy pines, yellow berries. Light bodied, bit fluffy, easy, round. A clean nice drinkable light ipa. Amazingly flavourful for the abv. Summer thirst quencher.-- bb

Can. Pours orange with a nice, white head. Aroma is pine and citrus. Taste is hoppy: Pine and citrus here as well. No malt flavors, not much in the way of body. Strong carbonation. Hop juice, but good at that, especially at these alcohol levels.
Thanks Tony. Hazy golden with foamy white head. Nice mild citrus aroma. Taste is sweet and citrusy, alcohol is not missing at all. I could drink many many of these.
Bottle. Hazy golden pour with a white head. Nice citrus hop aroma and lightly bitter taste. A low alcohol beer that can go toe to toe with most any session IPA. Really good stuff.

Can. Cornflower yellow, massive white head. Big citrus hop aroma, slightly pungent. Citrus hops dominate the palate, light crackery malts. Holy smokes, if Im going to drink a low alcohol beer then I want it to be nearly hop juice like this stuff!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottled. Golden colour with a small white head. Aroma is herbs, grass, mild bready and caramelly notes. Flavour is fruity, floral, biscuity and also has a nice crisp malty like note to it. Refreshing and quite pleasant low abv beer.

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2015 Ive had this before and I think I was unsure how to take this beer. Its really good. Sure its 2.7% but who fucking cares. All i care about is the taste and it tastes really fucking good. Tons of citrus and tropical fruits. Its not in your face and at 2.7 it really shoudnt be. I poured a 12oz can into a tulip glass. I was canned on 4/29/14 and cost $3.20 ($0.27 per ounce).

Appearance: Glowing shade of white gold. Slightly hazy, but some carbonation is visible. Pours to a two-finger, white, soapy head which retains and laces well.

Smell: Light herbal aroma, with hints of seasonings and citrus. Interesting combination.

Taste: Session IPAs are all the rage these days, though I think Evil Twin Bikini Beer was one of the pioneers of the style. What sets it apart is the fact it truly is sessionable at only 2.7% ABV, yet it has the flavor and body of something almost twice its size. Hops play a major role here, from beginning to end in terms of both flavor and bitterness. Up front theres a light citrusy component of lemon or orange peels, with an underlying dry bitterness. I get notes of green tea through the middle, but a strong herbal sensation on the finish. A mixture of basil or pesto or oregano  yet its still quite mild overall. The only bummer is theres not much in the way of true malt distinctiveness, though given the lightweight of the brew thats not surprising. This walks a fine line between what is and is not a novelty beer, as it could go either way for me. 

Drinkability: Simply having a light body does not a session beer make. Evil Twin Bikini Beer is one of the few rare hop-centric session beers thats not ridiculously one dimensional. While the mouthfeel is thin, its consistently carbonated and has absolutely no watery texture or consistency whatsoever. Its refreshing while in the mouth, and would be ideal for warm weather situations.

the aromas were lightly toasted malt, a little bread, and maybe a touch of biscuit, the hops were light grass, herb and floral, there was a touch of tropical fruit- orange and lemon with some fruit and malt sweetness, 

it had flavors of herb and faint grass hops, soft toasted malt and some fruit, there was very little to no sweetness in this drink, 
the finish had a gentle bitterness of hops that was drying with little malt flavor, 

it had a pretty light mouth feel and a little creaminess on the tongue, the carbonation was average or so, 

this was a nice light beer, a good beer for how low the alcohol was, I certainly like this beer better than the no alcohol beers, it does not have the off aroma and flavor of the no alcohol beers, this drink would be great for a hot Summer day.

pours a pale yellow with a creamy thin white head. aroma has nice light grass and hoppy spice. flavor follows suit...surprisingly flavorful for such a low abv beer...good hoppiness and light but not watery or too thin. tasty!
Amber beer, good sized head. Nothing overpowering anywhere here but what I am getting, fruit, hops, lemonpeel, works well for what it is. Fairly dry.
Fruity aroma with a hint of citrus. Cloudy caramel colour, with a lot of carbonation and a thick creamy head. A slightly bitter taste of citrus with a bitter citrus rind palate.

(can - 12 oz) Amber pour with a thick white head. Light hop and citrus aroma. Dry and stale grass and hop flavor with a lingering bitter finish. An interesting attempt at a low alcohol IPA, but not for me.
Honestly surprised I liked this, was a few beers in though, its a more sensible nightcap.

Can... Poured clear, pale golden with a nice forming head. This was well hopped and bitter. The dryness and light mouthfeel begs for this to be consumed directly from the can. Grainy, resinous, earthy spiced yet light and crisp and easy going down.

Healthy cloudy orange pour with a full inch of fluffy bright white head, healthy white lacing. Tropical aroma of pineapple, peach and lemon, resinous hops as well. Lively carbonation, somewhat thin mouthfeel, dry finish. Taste is amazing, low ABV or otherwise: nutty malts, tropical fruits like pineapple, piney hops, lemon rind. Cant wait to drink this in summer.
can. Golden with two finger head. This really exceeded expectations. For a low ABV beer, this is absolutely packed with flavor. Big fruity hops, both citrus and pineapple. Excellent session IPA.

Light retention with some lacing. Smells of sweet malt, lemon grass and tropical hops. Tastes of floral, slight hop notes and lemon grass. Bitter and flat aftertaste ruins it for me.

text: Can with Puerto Rican food in the VPS terminal. Best compliment for this beer is it is a well made IPA. Not a good "low alcohol" IPA, because this is so much better than 99.9% of low alcohol brews. This should be compared to all IPAs.

From the can in a pint glass. Pours a clear yellow with a giant white head, almost soda like. Nose is a lot of citrus, mostly lemon, grapefruit. Very light body, lemon and hints of zest with some pine in the finish. Just a hint of sweetness. Balanced, as a session ipa this is impressive.

12 ounce can from Wine Warehouse, Charlottesville. Pours a hazy amber color with a large foamy off-white head. Decent head retention. Aroma of spicy, citrus, tropical hops and a hint of caramel malt. The taste is dry citrus, dry crackery malts, zest, pith. Thin-bodied.

Pours a clear golden color with a two-finger, soapy foam, white head. Grapefruit pulp, sweet lemon, and light onion aromas. Crisp texture and astringency. Chalky, seltzerish flavor underlies weakly expressed grapefruit. Bitterness appears without having had the satisfaction of the flavor that usually precedes it. Nothing on the can indicates a session IPA. I shouldve paid attention to the abv. Shame on them. There wont be a shame on me.

Poured from can to glass. Light orange hue with fizzy white head. Aroma is hops, citrus, grapefruit, sugars, limes, straw, slight pepper. Taste is a dry sweetness initially with a great bitter following and a metallic astringentness in the finish. Mouthfeel is nice with a lighter body and great carbonation. Overall this is a tastier brew than I had ever anticipated but nothing really special either.

WillRunForBeer suppliedmany thanks! Consumed at my place with an annoying cat glaring at me to be fed. This is a sediment-heavy yellow paled Low Alcohol beverage cradling a razor-thin, bubble-crazed head which was all white: 1 finger in length. Grabbed flavors of muskmelon seeds, pine bark, Bible paper, sweat, and cucumber water. Thin and memorable. Best Low Alcohol beer Ive rated. Okay: this is the ONLY Low Alcohol beer Ive rated.

Can. Big crusty white head on it. A beautiful light, fruity hop aroma jumps out of the glass sweet and pineapple-y. It drinks well. Not too thin, very smooth and with that delicious hop flavor all over it. The bitterness is in check too. I think, come summer, I might be buying a decent amount of this.
Bottle. Pours cloudy golden brown with a huge white head that lingers and clings. Smells like a floral hand soap. Flavor of wheat, cereal, a touch of citrus and a touch of pine bitter in the finish.
Golden colored body, large white head, dense lacing. Peach, grass, light citrus, mellow cereals. Light bodied, moderate carbonation, clean, refreshing finish.

On tap at Tørst. Really awesome for the ABV. Pretty amazing. Goes down really smooth. Bit of a novelty but good.

A delicate frothy white two inch head floats on a softly hazed amber body initially showing off several assertive streamers, a few thick short peninsulas of frothy lace

A mild dose of clean peach, orange, lemon, and garlic hop characteristics, with additional green melon with warmth, dominate a faint biscuity malt note on a smooth light body with restrained carbonation producing a lasting layer of drying, lemon water dominant residuals, wish I could have gotten into this one a couple months earllier

12oz can with illegible code PKG 09/25/2013 (?) into Spiegelau authentis casual beer glass

Light gold/copper color, copious amounts of white head & lace. 

Surprisingly hop-filled aroma: piney, pungent hops. Crisp, clean, mildly hopped. No shortage of flavor here. Impressive for a 2.7% ABV brew.

Pours a ruddy golden color with a thick and fluffy white head that dissipates slowly. Small patches of lacing on the glass. Aroma of hops, tropical fruit and pine. Light and crisp body with flavors of floral hops, mangoes and sweet malt. The finish is piney with a mildly bitter lingering hoppy aftertaste. Decent overall, and pretty incredible accomplishment (albeit pricey) at 2.7%.
Can thanks to ygtbsm94: Poured a hazy orange with huge white head. Aroma is strong sticky fruit and light hops. Taste is floral fruit hops, nice long lasting into a mild refreshing finish.

Smells like a solid ipa. Nice hop aroma. Floral. And a light malt balance. Tastes of floral hops with a bitter finish. Is a bit watery on the palate, as can be expected for such a light beer. That is probably its biggest downer. Good flavors but without the malt balance and watery palate I would much prefer all day ipa to this for a light ipa. Also prefer the hop profile of all day. But for something so light it isnt bad. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Le fix de houblons parfait, nez hyper floral et agrumeux avec même un élan sucré surprenant. Une fois en bouche, je suis attaqué par un assaut floral et une intense amertume pour un si minuscule liquide. Buvabilité biblique.

Can. Gold pour, white head, little retention/some lace. Aroma of tropical, grassy, citrus hops, light caramel. Taste is moderately bitter, big tropical/grassy hops, cracker/caramel malt. Palate is soft, quenching, a bit thin, bitter finish. Very good -- the perfect session beer.
Can. Yellow gold with an off white head. Sweet and hoppy aroma. Hay, grass and slightly bitter. Tons of flavor for such low ABV.
I didnt realize "diet beer" could be this good. A hugely hoppy beer. Lots of pine and citrus, though eminently sessionable.

Tons of flavor for a 2.7%r. Tons of citrus and grassy hop bite with not much else but who needs anything else. Hops taste good and therefor this was good. Im gonna start quaffing these. Time to throw out the 1 piece, here I come summer.

Tap at birch. Our is clear golden, small white head, disappears quickly, little lacing. Aroma is total citra, citrus, pine, Passionfruit. Flavor has little sweetness and is basically hop water, but oh so good. Light body, of course.

Tap - small foamy head, medium copper color, balanced aroma and flavor, earthy hops and caramel malts, kind of creamy texture - not bad but not great, good for a low alcohol beer I guess

It poured a clear light golden color with a small white head. The aroma was very citrusy with lots of floral notes. The taste was also citrusy and a little bitter. Not bad.

Can pour light golden thick white head. Nose pine, mango, and resin hop. Taste bitter biter up front. Lose the aromatic hop in the taste. Decently strong malt presence. Mild finish. Fairly light beer matching the abv.

Bottle. Pours a rusty orange golden pour with a small head. Nose is all citrus with some light pine and resin. Needless to say, very light but flavorful, with citrus and pine notes. Finishes on some bitter citrus notes. This "sissy beer " wins over any macro lager. Given the category, and rated as such, quite decent. Quaff Score 7/ 10

Pours an amber orange with an off white head and hoppy, citrus aroma. Taste is very light as expected, but nice flavors of hops and citrus while crisp with some bitterness given the abv and style. Alot more flavor then expected, hops and citrus get through nicely given abv, easy drinking and great brew for style

Burk från Connecticut Avenue Wine & Liquor Deli, Washington DC. Bärnstensfärgad med vitt skum. Doftar tropisk fruktighet, viss citronsyrlighet och tallbarr. Inbjudande. For a beer with such a low abv, the amount of flavor is remarkable. The aroma is full of fresh spicy hops and on the palate, there isn't much there from the malts but the hops are tasty. Great session ale.

12 ounce can

A top notch beer proves that not all low alcohol beers have to be tasteless boring water. This is definitely a beer that would be easy to finish at the beach despite the slightly more expensive price tag. Id still love to try Nanny State to see how it stacks up.

Aroma / Appearance - The foamy head surges before it collapses in mere seconds. A transparent rose gold base remains behind. Light grassy hops, orange polish, and gentle malts are easy on the senses but still inviting enough to remind one of a higher gravity IPA.

Flavor / Palate - The watery mouthfeel is expected for a light sessionable beer under 3% ABV. Gentle hops brighten the palate. At $2.99 a bottle it is a bit expensive for a daily drinker but is worth drinking on occasion. Id split it with people new to beer just to show them there is more to life than BMC.
Amazing amount of hop flavor in this light beer. Refreshing, mild, but notable grassy/pine/resin flavors come out here. Very drinkable.

Bottle at Cajun Cafe Fall Beer Fest. Pours a medium yellow-orange with a white head. Nose is some light malt and some grassy and citrusy hops. Flavor is similar with some light malt, some grassy and citrusy hops. Can it compete with other higher ABV session IPAs? Not at all. Can it compete with any other beer at this gravity? Blows them all out of the water! Very nice for what it is, but it would not be my everyday drinker.

Can. Pours a cloudy light orange color with a small fizzy head that quickly fades to a ring. Aromas are pine, grapefruit, grass, flowers and bread. Taste has tons of flavor for such a low abv. Hops are smooth here unlike many session IPAs Ive had. Strong grapefruit and grass hops with some pine, flowers, and grape must. Medium body. One of the best session IPAs Ive had and this will be my new go-to tailgating beer.
#2.25 can from Wine Warehouse, CHO. Pours golden, tiny white head. Smells of hops and some skunk. Tastes of plain, lightly citrus hops. Not a lot of other flavor in there.

Dry, hop asssertive. LIght body. Ok can. This may be the best 3 rating Ive ever given out - you can definitely tell its light/low alcohol beer, but for what it is its pretty tasty. Whole Foods, @ Refuge House fundraiser.

Tallahassee, Fl - Whole Foods - Brews and Bites fundraiser - poured from a can. Medium golden pour, soft white head. Nice spruce induced aroma, very fresh. Flavor is surprisingly bold and full with plenty of citrusy grapefruit bitterness, a touch of grassiness, some yeasty notes in the back end. Mouthfeel is nice and smooth. Will definitely consider this for tailgating and beach trips.

Pale golden pour. Thin white head. The nose is lightly hoppy with notes of citrus and a bit of soft pale malt. Light but not watery body with a fairly assertive bitterness. A little bit yeasty but quite balanced. A very quaffable beer that I quite enjoyed.

Une bouteille de 33 cl. Un petit bikini doré et une tête compactée. Des parfums de chanvre, des épinettes, de la sueur citronnée, du thé et des pamplemousses. Des saveurs fraîches. Des aiguilles de conifères, des fleurs hawaïennes, une lueur de pêche et des quartiers de lime. Une bouche légère et bien aérée qui ne donne jamais limpression dêtre aqueuse. Une finale qui est très sèche, piquée par les cônes dune épinette et enveloppée par la résine dun bouquet floral. Impressionnant.

6 pack cans from Proof bottle shop. Gold pour with thin white head. Aroma is floral hops and citrus. Tastes are grass, soapy grapefruit bitter, grainy, herbal. Quite a lot to it considering the low profile. Easy drinking beach beer.
2.7%. No shit. Taste is light, refreshing, lightly hopped, ctirus and lightly malted. Well balanced and has a popping flavor for such a light one..

Hearty grapefruit punch for the nose, underneath it some mango and pine. Orange color with tiny sediment. Very bitter, like grapefruit juice itself only less sweet. The lightest IPA, or beer of any kind, I can remember having, and it isnt too bad. Unfortunately it is on the light bodied side, comes off as mere bitter water by the end.

Hazed orange, strong head at first,lacing. Aroma is piney, sharp-raw grassy, light fruit,citrus, catpiss amonia, some breadiness.Like a good ipa.
Taste is hoppy,grassy,citrus,smooth,light,piney.Slight caramel sweetness.Strong grapefruit bitter. Great session ipa for those who like lots of hops but low abv. You almost wouldnt know its that low in abv. Overpriced. Impressive that it has some noticable maltiness/body yet its so light as a light beer  > 90cal. Best "light" beer ive ever had.

Damn skipster! This is fantastic .. . Was really worried this would be bad, tons of dark sediment .. . Pours gold .. Solid foam head .. . Delicate hop presence, almost a Mosaic feel .. . Easy mouthfeel and very drinkable .. . I could drink a case of this in an afternoon no sweat .. . . Wearing a tophat nowadays makes you look like a gentleman looney..
Canned. Nice aroma. Watery but obviously to be expected. A pretty decent small beer. Good for drinking and driving.
12 ounce can. Pours a golden amber with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus and grass. Taste is grapefruit, grass, pine, and a bit of malt. Very enjoyable.

12oz can from "Lifesource" in Salem.
Did not know this is only 2.7%, I am apprehensive now.
$2.59
Certainly pours nice enough, light orange,slighly hazy, large ,impressive frothy white head.
Plenty citric hopping in the aroma, some hay in the background.
Nice bright lemon zest/orange pits hop taste, little bread..quite nice really
Mouthfeel is understandably weak but it has enough carbonation to carry the beer.
Very acceptable brew for 2.7..wish I had seen this during camping season!

Whole Foods, Bowery can ($3): Pours orange with a quickly dissipating white head. Aroma is grapefruit hops and a tiny bit of malts. Taste is rather hoppy. It tastes like an attenuated IPA. I have had beers with more alcohol taste more watery than this. Good job.

Can. Poured clear yellow color with an average white frothy head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate citrus hop, yeast and malt aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium balanced flavor with a medium balanced finish of moderate duration. Drinkable starter brew.

Near clear straw to gold pour with a 2 finger, creamy white head. Aroma is full of citrus, a cat boxy pine and just a touch of passion fruit-like tropical fruity hops, light toast and mineral notes. Flavor is very hoppy right away, lots of spicy and citrus hops, a touch of herbal and pine, but little of the tropical fruit I pick up in the nose, some toast, hay and mineral notes com in toward the nicely hoppy and fairly bitter finish that has just the faintest touch of a medicinal note on the fade. Light, dry body with a slightly oily feel on the palate and a moderate strength, but very lively carbonation. Really good stuff overall, plenty of hop for the alcohol content, not surprisingly not a huge amount going on with the malt or yeast sides though. Nice crisp summer session ale for people who dont mind paying crazy prices for session ales. @ $11.99/6pk. I certainly wont be making to many sessions of it, but that doesnt change the fact that it is very enjoyable and tastes like they probably use tons of hops per batch.

12 oz can purchased as a single at Old Town in Louisville, Kentucky. The pour is a hazed copper golden with a small, though well formed, light tan head. The aroma is citrus, floral and light pine hop notes, along with a cracker grain malt. The taste is fuller than I expected for the ABV, nice balanced between the bright fresh citrus floral pine hop and the cracker malt. The palate is light bodied, though I didnt find it watery at all, which is quite an achievement. Dry, softly crisp bitter finish. I really liked this beer, I must have gotten a fresh can - I would imagine age would impact this beer quite a bit.

Can. Pours hazy deep golden with a thin off-white head. Smell is pungent funky citrus, wheat bread, faint floral notes, some pine, light grapefruit and sweet malt. Taste is very light, a little funky earthy notes, some pine, faint fresh grapefruit juice and light hops. Thin watered down IPA, good carbonation. Not a bad beer but prefer a bigger flavored beer.
Nice light, crisp finish. Just grain and not much else here. Not bad for what it is. Pours amber with no head or lacing. On tap at Prohibition Pig.
Smells ok. Looks ok. Watery for an IPA. I guess thats cool since its less than 3.2. Its good for what it is I guess.
12oz can. Looks light. Aroma of citrusy and piney hops plus very light malts. Flavor the same. Light texture. Not bad for such a low alcohol beer.

Serving: 12 oz. can at Leesburg Brewing Company. It pours a surprisingly dark ruddy color with a small, frothy white head. The nose has some pungent citrus and herbal notes. Thin bordering on watery on the tongue. Those citrus hop notes come through, but thats kind of it. Given the low ABV, I guess you have to give up something. Very light body with a lengthy bitter finish. Almost like hop water. Or cold hop tea. Interesting.

Aroma: Simcoe-esque character with lots of myrcene (lemongrass, verbena) along with a bit of citrus; if this is Simcoe, its among the most pleasant uses ive encountered. A touch of caramel rounds out things. Appearance: Still, rich gold body with a ring of white head. Flavor: Hops all the way; malt character virtually non-existent (as expected). Hops tend toward lemongrass and verbena. Palate: Light body, slick texture, flat carbonation, very bitter finish. Overall: A great session beer for Simcoe fans, and good enough to attract attention otherwise.

Had draught and can side by side. Preferred the can and will be rating as such

Burst of citrus, and mango on the nose. Flavor was clean, light hoppineas and incredibly well balanced.

Can:
Dark gold/amber with a large, white, rough webbed head.
Sugary,lemon aroma.
Taste is much the same,
Grassy, spicy hops.
Hyper-light IPA.....not bad.

12oz can, from Party Source. Poured into my DFH IPA glass. Mostly hazy golden orange color. Good, thick, big slightly off-white head. Nice grassy hop, light citrus, very satisfying. Moderate bitter taste, little to no sweet. Some spicy hop. Light to medium body, but surprisingly not at all watery. Smooth, crisp lighter carbonation, with a lightly dry texture. Amazing stuff. Was not expecting so much hop character from a 2.7% beer, but it earns the IPA moniker. Might guess its 5-6% from the taste, really impressive. Perhaps the ultimate low alcohol session IPA.
12oz can (I picked this over the Falco because it was in a can and I like bikinis) - pours gold with white head. Nose is grass that a cat just peed on. Flavor adds hay. Watery but quite hoppy.
Aroma is hoppy piney and grassy. Appears clear light caramel with fluffy slightly off white head. Taste is hoppy and bitter with a watery nature that makes this very drinkable. Cool beer.

From the can. As expected this is very light but has an impressive amount of flavor. Would work well on the beach but youd have to drink a case to get even remotely buzzed. Flavor is toasty corn light grain and some grassy hops. A bit of lemon effervescence.
Can from chaleston, very light extremely drinkable hoppy seltzer water, this would be popular if it wasnt for the price, way to pricey, too bad

Pours golden / light copper with a modest off white head. The aroma has piny, earthy and floral hops traits. There is a light caramel presence offering a bit of balance. Light crisp body with a decent amount of mildly sharp carbonation. The flavor starts out with pine, grapefruit and earthy hops and a malt character is very crackery & takes a back seat to the hops. The finish has some spicy hops, a bit of minerals and a lingering hops bitterness. Really dig this one. Hope I can get this fresh on a regular basis. Less that 3% and lots of hops is a winner.

big, big hoppy aroma. slightly hazy medium gold color. big white head. almost a catty hop character. serious hop flavor and hop bitterness. definitely hops over malt. light-medium body. theres a building hop bitterness in the finish/aftertaste.
Bottle at Arakataka, Oslo. Amber with a smallish head. Peachy nose, slightly sour. Good brett flavours adds complexity and dryness. Surprisingly good.
bottle into IPA glass of happiness... pale yellow clear pour with white sticky head, very light ipa, but not unpleasant, could drink a lot of these ... overall would have again

UPDATED: SEP 13, 2013 Evil Twin Bikini Beer, take 2 (this time with a fresh can): 
Pours a hazy golden with a medium well retained head and some nice lacing on the glass.
 
The aroma is pretty much just piney and citrusy hops. Some nice lime rind in there, some light limestone. Pretty damned inviting. 
 
The flavor is very hoppy, again with piney and citursy hops, the flavor brings a bit of a dank character and the hops provide a very satisfying level of bitterness. The sweetness level is very low but lingers in the background. Mild iced tea flavors are not unpleasant in the mix. 
 
The beer is thin and a touch watery, but the palate is sharp enough to give the tongue something to cling to...
 
Pretty good stuff. 






 
I was informed by the Evil Twin himself that the bottle I had rated was well over a year old,,, so the notes below are I suppose indicative of a year old bottle of Evil Twin Bikini Beer: 
Pours a hazy golden with a medium well retained head and some nice lacing on the glass.
 
The aroma has some nice fruity hoppiness, some light minerally character, some soap.... its sort of sweet smelling. Not bad, just one of those where you dont quite know what to make of it. One whiff is nice, one is grate, one is unappealing... yknowwhat I mean?
 
The flavor is sort of tea like up front, its got some hop fruitiness, some soapiness, & in general is a little too caramel malt forward for my taste. On the other hand the bitterness is at a really nice satisfying level. 
 
Considering the low cost this must have been one of the US brewed Evil Twin beers & it just hit the shelf... Ive got to assume this was fresh, but alas it did taste a little like an IPA that had spent a little too much time on the shelf.  
That said, it does what loads of crappy-ish IPAs seem to do flavor-wise at twice the ABV of this one, in fact this is better than plenty of IPAs Ive tried @ that strength. So I dont know... I love the idea behind this one, just needs to lift a little harder in the hop brightness department.































 
2.7% = low boost.
The wife and I were mixed on this--I liked it, she didnt so much. Citrus flavors, nice and light. Could certainly drink many of them!
Very pleasant citrus and malt aroma. Flavor is light and spicy. Thin finish, not shocking for something this light. Overall a really good beer on a hot day.

Amber pour with slight foamy head clear but some particles. Smells of skunky piny hops and lychees. Full hops flavor, not too bitter. Some peach wheat and citrus flavors coming out. Can tell its low alcohol though. Slighted than moderate carb and pleasant slight buttery mouthfeel.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2014 Old rating, 0,33l bottle @ home:
Frisk lett syrlig lukt med preg av lys malt, masse humle, brett, overmoden krekling, kattepiss, høy, sitrus, sitrusskal. Frisk tørr smak med preg av lys malt, masse humle, brett, høy, gras, sitrusskal, barnåler. God bitterhet som set litt. Veldig god.

12 ounce bottle. Pours a translucent, darker copper with a beige head of foam. Nice lacing and good retention. Aroma is mild earthy his with a touch of graininess. Tastes grassy and herbal. Some bitterness strikes through in the finish to dry things out.

NYC Trip Beer #15.  Second beer at Tørst.  This beer had me raving.  I cant believe it is low alcohol.  I beg of you Evil Twin, make this in bigger batches, can it, and sell it in suitcases that I could take to the beach.  Pours hazy and orangish.  Smells piney with hints of Christmas spices.  Tastes of passion fruit and citrus.  Well carbonated thanks to Tørsts insane draft system.  I think many beer drinkers would be hard pressed to differentiate between this and any top notch IPA.  Love, love, loved it.  Draft - Tørst - New York, NY

Overall this is still pretty enjoyable, and quite flavorful for such a low session beer. However, its a little off kilter and its not impressive to look at it, but tastes surprisingly well.. surprising. I would have this again.

Bottle from the Charleston Beer Exchange.  Murky copper pour with a milky eggshell head that coats the inside of the glass.  Earthy, spicy, grassy, malty nose.  Extremely dusty and dirty.  Bottom line, this one is more flavorful than one would expect from a low alcohol brew.  Not bad.

Bottle from Greenville Beer Exchange. Pouts dark orange with a thin white head that leaves trace lacing. Nice pineapple notes on the nose. Wasnt expecting that from a low alcohol beer. Nicely balanced bitterness. Keeps thing nice and tidy without being overpowering. Very nice!

Bottle from CBX. Wow, nice job on this one. Clear light golden pour with a small white head. Big citrusy aroma with lots of floral notes. Nose is legit. Pleasure to smell. Flavors were citrusy and big time bitter. Body was light without being watery. Real nice job. Best beer I've had >3% no doubt.

Nose of citrus, grapefruit and orange peel notes, some dank, very light onion notes, just a hint of light grain. Pours golden with a nice white head and good clarity. Flavors of nice bitter citrus fruit grapefruit and orange peel, some dank, a little green onion, very light malt sweetness underneath, a touch of grain. Big lingering hop bitterness, good carbonation, great drinkability and flavor. Good stuff!

Draft at Redlight. Load this bad boy up in a beer bong for me please. Clear golden pour with a white head. Grassy, citrus hops with some grainy pale malts throughout the aroma and flavor profile. Light, crisp hoppy and refreshing. Definitely crushable.
Gold, white head. Nose is hops, earth, straw, grass. Taste is light citrus fruits, grass, straw, bitter finish. Light crisp mouthfeel. Incredibly flavorful for the low abv.

On tap at Torst. Pours a light hazy golden orange with a thin white foam head.  Aroma of grapefruit and earthiness.   Has a light sweet citrus taste with a slight  hop layer.  Too light but plenty of flavor.
March 2013. Amber color with a white head. For a beer that light and with so low alcohol, it really delivers. Good hoppiness and flavors. I can see this become my summer beer.

Nice low ABV selection. Kind of like the Avery Joe's pilsner. First couple sips take a little getting used to. Good bitterness but a little hollow.
