Sampled at EBF.  Pours a hazy amber with some white head.  Nose has plenty of hops and citrus.  Flavor is nice and hoppy, some cereal, malt.  Medium bodied, zesty finish.

Bottle. Hazy golden colour with a thick white head. Strong citric hop aroma. Surprisingly in a beer with this low abv. Very bitter citric flavour. Rather sour. Might be a bad infected bottle. Will have to try again.

Bottle 0,33L. Dark orange/amber colour with off-white head. Mostly hoppy aroma of grapefruit, elderberry and grass. Moderate bitter taste with heavy bitter short lasting aftertaste, light bodied and crispy. Dry, watery beer for hot summer days...
Pours chunky gold into a snifter. Bright white head with medium retention recedes leaving slight sheets to hug rim. Orange and resin aromas. Dry with caramel and resin and earthy bitterness.

Tap at Mekong in Richmond VA. Pours a clear, deep golden. Webby white lace. Nose is excellent starfruit, cantaloupe, Grapefruit, tangerine. Taste is spicy, almost Brett heavy with fresh dough and Rayon Vert style hoppy, doughy, super aerated palate. Quenching, bitter, sharp. Really awesome.
Aroma is pine/grapefruit and grassy hops.  The flavor is grapefruit, citrus/lime/kiwi, thin body and a resiny hop finish.

11.2 oz. Bottle. 
Poors hazy orange with good white head. 
Aroma grapefruit, fruits, sugar, candy. 
Taste fresh medium bitter
Mouth-feel thin. High Carbo. 
Nice low alcohol IPA.

Bottle. Tan body with fluffy white head. Gives off appearance of a large beer but drink ad smooth as odouls

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
bottle. pours bud light yellow with full white head. aroma of faint grass. taste is very crisp and mild with just a touch of earth coming in.

12/31/12. Happy New Year! 11.2oz bottle from Grassroots Natural Market. The label says India Pale Ale 2.7%. Woot! 
Mostly clear golden pour with a fizzy off-white head that sticks pretty well and laces in sloppy sheets. Fresh green hop aroma with some pale malts and corniness in there. Lightly bitter, lightly sour/acidic hop flavor with a lingering pale malt presence and even more lingering dry bitterness. Goes down easy. Tasty.
Bottle. Pours orange with à white head. Notes of Green gooseberries, grape and white wine in aroma. Heavy gooseberry notes in taste. Bitter and slightly chemical finish. Refreshing.

A - Clear golden-orange with a finger of frothy white head. Fades medium.

S - Sweet grainy and wheat malts, grapefruit, citrus, floral, and grassy hops, bit of lemon zest.

T - Sweet grainy and wheat malts, grapefruit, citrus, tropical, floral and grassy hops, some bitterness, some lemon zest.

M - Medium-light bodied moderate carbonation. Smooth with a sweet, dry, bitter finish.

D - Nicely balanced. Great amount of hop flavor and complexity for so low ABV.

Bottle from NK Saluhall, December 2012.

Hazy amber with a medium white head. Hoppy and fruity aroma of citrus, pine and some grass. Bitter taste, weak body. Rather long aftertaste. An ok beer given the low ABV.

Bottled, from NK, Stockholm.  Hazy deep golden, mid sized head. Rich hop aroma of tropical fruits and gooseberries. Dryish with thin mouthfeel. Hard with aggressive, resiny bitterness. Nice arom, but low drinkability.
Dark orange and hazy. Has a wihte head, medium duration. Heavy hoppy aroma, citrus and fruits. Flavor starts light sweet, then harsh bitter. Watery, dry-dry texture.
heavy hoppy aroma,amber, hazy, off white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, light body, oily feel, lively, bitter, long finish,
Bottle from BrewDog Glasgow. Reddish brown colour, not much head. Resin hop aroma & flavour.  Strong hoppy aftertaste. Big taste for a low alcohol beer.

Pours gold with a nice white head. A little sediment. Nice piney hops on the nose. Uncomplex, quite bitter. Fizzy mouthfeel, a little watery.  Short finish. Never had a low alcohol beer, might as well make a US craft my first. Not a bad pale ale.

Tap. Pours clear gold with average, frothy white head; good retention and lacing. Aroma is dank and grassy hops, biscuit and cereal malt, lemon, pine, and light funk. Flavor is bitter, grassy hops forward with supporting sweet malt and citrus fruit esters, mostly grapefruit; dry, hoppy finish. Light body and medium carbonation.

Tap at Maxs Taphouse.  Pours clear copper with a medium, creamy white head, medium retention with excellent lacing.  Aroma is earthy, herbal, grassy, and floral hops with straw and cereal malt.  Flavor is heavy hops and bitterness with light malt and fruity esters and a dry finish.  Light body and medium carbonation.

330ml Bottle - Hazy amber with a foamy head. Passion fruit, grapefruit, pine and toffee in the aroma. Tangy and hoppy with grapefruit, pineapple and some soapy notes. Very refreshing and so much flavour for the strength.

Bottle. Amber pour with a tall, frothy white head. Aroma is rather hoppy with strong floral notes and citrus fruit atop soft caramel. Taste is floral hops, citrus fruit, hop resins, sweet malt and caramel notes. Body is medium with a moderate, bubbly carbonation and a pleasant lingering hop bitterness. Finishes with more strong hop notes, floral hops, citrus oils, pine resins and caramel. The ultimate sessionable IPA?
Pours a hazy and amber beer with a white head. The aroma is malt and hops with peach and tropical fruit. The flavor follows the nose. The palate is bitterness. Overall a good beer.

Bottle poured a hazy gold with a lasting off white head. Aromas of biscuit, earthiness, skunkbud, pine and grapefruit. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry finish. Flavors of biscuit, earthiness, grapefruit and pine with a crisp dry bitter lingering earthy finish.

Bottle. Pours dark golden, with a finger thick head. Aroma is tropical, flowers and bitter lemon. Flavour is bitter orange peel, with some tropical notes of apricot. Long bitter finish of grapefruit and lemon.

On bottle 33cl. Very light with a wonderful hop taste. Very refreshing and easy to drink. This beer can be draught even at breakfast due to its lightness. Flat head having no persistence. In any case, its simply great!
tap.   really nice sessionable low abv hoppy pale ale.  citrus and tropical fruit hops with a clean toast caramel malt backing.   dry.     not terribly potent, but easy drinkin to be sure.
Draft.  Hazy golden color, white edge head.  Aroma of bitter grass and subtle lemon.  Taste is similar.  very flavorful stuff.

Draft.  Medium off-white head, clear amber body.  Aroma is medium sweet, dank, some straw/grapefruit, light orange.  Taste is medium sweet, straw/grapefruit, some dank.  Soft light body, some acidity.

In short: A 2.7% beer with the hopping (citrusy/floral) of a 6% IPA.  Superb summer hop-fix
How: Tap at Cardinal, Stavanger Norway, sold as Lervig Take It Easy which is aliased on ratebeer as Evil Twin Bikini Beer
The look: Clear golden-blond body topped by persistent small white head
In long: Nose is in-your-face hoppy with a ton of fresh citrusy and floral hops.  A slender body but never watery, which is as much as one can expect from a 2.7% beer.  Basic crackery malts with lots and lots of hops hops, bitter grapefruits and floral aromatic.  Sharp bitterness of medium intensity.  I wouldnt buy a not-so-fresh bottle in North-America, but fresh on tap in Norway this was a really nice low abv beer.  So I bought a pint of this beer at Cardinal and it was called Lervig Take It Easy and now Im entering my rating and I see that it is aliased as Evil Twin Bikini Beer so obviously ehh I dont know what my point is or where I wanted to go with this. if only I had a dollar for each and every time lost my train of thought I dont like country music.
On draft at an evil twin food pairing at ChurchKey in DC. Pours a  clear copper with an off white head. Citrus aroma. Nice IPA for low abv version.
Non bella da vedere, buon aroma che fa presagire una birra buona che però si rivela solo amara, unico pregio si può dire che nonostante la bassa gradazione ha sapore anche se sapore amaro.

UPDATED: SEP 29, 2015 Color: cloudy blond bronze beer with medium carbonation and big light white foam. Smell: exotic fruits as mango, pineapple, litchi and peaches. Taste: good hops sensation, with nice floral complexity. Aftertaste : small bitterness. Really fresh!
Super drinkable, very session able, clear amber big off white head, nice lacing... Decently hoppy, very fruity, flavorful for so low... Awesome...

12 oz. bottle, pours a hazy golden orange with a small beige head. Nose is dominated by biscuity malts and mild skunky, herbal hops - quite light. Flavour is very bland, with lots of stale biscuity malts - that pretty much characterizes this. The hops taste completely dead / stale / lifeless, but they are there. For an under 3% brew, I guess its alright, but Im rating this based on overall enjoyability. Not so good to me. Mikkellers Drinkin the Sun beers are much better.

Bottle. Golden amber with slightly off white head. Pungent aroma, guava, mango and papaya, tropical fruit hops bordering on cheesey, some biscuit and caramel. Taste is balanced and light, caramel, biscuit, citrus, mango and guava. Tad thin, as expected, crisp and clean. Very nice. Different to what I was expecting but I like this. Incredibly drinkable
Sample at SBWF 2012. Smell of grass and a hint of dill. Not as fresh as the others I tried at the same time (Drinkin the Sun and Sundancer). Nice bitterness and light malty body.

Bottle at Stockholm Beer and Whiskey Festival 2012. Clear golden liquid with medium white head. Aroma of biscuit, citrus, grain, grapefruit and some grass. Taste is dry and light bitter with notes of grassy hops. Light bodied with medium carbonation, quite watery. All right, good for the style.

Clear light brown body and frothy soapy head. Light modern hops and a surprisingly malty backbone. Definitely full enough for the abv. Not powerful obviously, but surely rich enough and easy drinkable. Good! (At Colins De Molen Tuesday Tasting)

Sample at the monthly molen beer tasting.
Nice grassy hoppy aroma.  Thin white head.  Clear golden blond pour.  Nice bitter taste.  Great for a low alcohol beer

Bottle at home from brewdog online
Pale amber with fluffyhead, lots of mango rind and oranges, quite a lot of body for a beer so weak, could quaff a few of these.

Huge offwhite head.  Pale amber body made hazy by little
particles.  Resiny tropical fruit aroma with wooden citrusy
notes.  Dry wooden resiny taste with chalky tropical fruit notes.
Thin body.  Slightly harsh, chalky mouthfeel.  Dry mango and
pineapple aftertaste with chalky wooden metallic notes.  Its not
bad, but its much too harsh. (0.33l bottle, Lørenskog Brusshop,
Lørenskog.)

Bottle. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Dark yellow colour. MOderate malty and hoppy aroma. Flowery nice ipa-hops notes. Heavy bitter nice flavor. Average heavy bitter finish. Oily palate. IPA-ish LA. Really nice.

Clear light amber color with a white head. Some citrus hop aromas and a fairly heavy floral note. A bit of bread and toast, too. Maybe some melon, too. Light citric acidity on the palate with a lot of tangerine and grapefruit peel notes. Some green melon, toasted bread, and a fairly dry finish.

Draught as "Lervig Take it Easy" @ Cardinal, Stavanger
Pours clear golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, citrus, orange and grape. Taste is light sweet and medium bitter with a long fruity, dry and bitter finish. Body is light to medium, texture is thin, carbonation is soft.

(on tap @ Ølbaren) Pours a mostly clear golden with medium, white head. Good retention and lace. Aroma is pleasantly hoppy with tropical fruity notes and a hint of sodapop. Not terribly intense. Oily texture, medium carbonation, light body and a lingering, dry finish. Flavour is slightly more insisting than the aroma. Well balanced and with what seems like Nelson Sauvin notes. Clearly very sessionable.

330 ml bottle. Amber and crystal clear. Small off-white head. Tropical fruit aroma with hints of sauvignon blanc. Hoppy. Eucalyptus. Nice refreshing hop bitterness. Body is, as expected, rather light. Light malty flavours mixed with lots of hops. Bitter finish.
Bottle from Kokkens Vinhus, Glostrup. Amber colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt and fruit.

From Skjold Burne, Aarhus, DK.
Bottled, 080912.
Amber with off-white head. Aromaof citrus and spruce. Flavour with grapefruit and esters.

Ar: passionfruit, pineapple, mango, citric, resin, hop juice, albeit not very strong, very enjoyable though.
Ap: Light copper colour, small off-white head.
F: big bite, long lingering bitterness, grapefruit, pine, Resin, low fruitiness and the bitterness has a medicinal quality, the malts are really understated and the beer actually feels a bit thin and watery.
M: Sharp carbonation.
T: Good low alcohol.
Pours golden with a white head. Aroma is malt, tropical fruit and citrus. Flavour is malt, citrus, peach and tropical fruit. A little edgy.

Bottle at Schouskjelleren, august 25th 2012. Clear golden body, small white head. Hoppy aroma with grapefruit, lemon, and malt. Crisp fruity taste with bubblegum, nice bitterness. Short finish, but for a beer this strength it is really nice.

Det här är en riktigt imponerande öl, med tanke på den låga alkoholhalten då alltså. Doften är dessutom så att man kan döda för den med mycket fläder och citrus. kroppen är förståeligt liten och beskan är därefter också sådan men det är trots det en riktigt rolig öl.

Bottle @ Home. Pours hazy orange with a offwhite head. Aroma of light maklt, citrus, light pine. Flavor of citrus, lemonpeel, light pine. Thin to medium body, lively carbonation. Nice low alcohol beer. 180812

Bottle at John Bull. An unclear, golden-orange beer topped by a small, off-white head. Citrusy, piney nose with some faint flowery notes, pale malts, some sugary notes and a touch, a really faint one, of burnt rubber. Rather thin on the palate, not eatery though, with pleasant carbonation. Lovely bitterness, really tuned to suit the rest of the experience. Some sweetness, notes of caramel, as well as citrus peel and resins. Long, bitter finish. It should be mandatory for every brewery to brew a low alcohol hoppy beer. 120816

33 cl bottle @ home. Pours slightly hazy amber with a white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma is citrusy and piney hops. Flavour follows the aroma but is slightly watery with a finish that is surprisingly dry and bitter.

On tap at Schouskjelleren.
Hazy yellow. Thin body, lots of hops, but the lack of malty body means it comes out a bit medical. Bitter tail.

On tap at Schouskjelleren. Clear golden with a small white head. Hoppy aroma with pine, fruit and citrus. A bit watery, but surprisingly flavourful for a low ABV beer. Dry and bitter finish. Very nice and refreshing. (2012-08-02)

Light hazy yellow colour with a white head. Fruity and a bit citric and flowery aroma. Rich flavour for a beer at 2,7%. Some fruity notes. Rich hoppiness. Maybee a bit light texture, but absolutely enjoyable.[On tap at Schouskjelleren Mikrobryggeri in Oslo, Norway]

On tap at Schouskjelleren 
Golden color, good foam.
Good hoppy intensity - some fruit.
Light/ medium body & medium complexity.
Ok bitterness
Enjoyable, very good at this percentage

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap at Cardinal as Lervig take it easy. Golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma is citrus, hop, pine. Flavour is citrus, hop, pine, fruit. Easy drinkable low alcohol beer.

On tap at Cardinal, Stavanger as Lervig Take It Easy. Pours clear golden with a small white head. Aroma of flowery and citrussy hops. Taste is rich for a low alcohol beer as this, dry with those fruity hops shining thru a light malty body. Good refresher.

On tap as Lervig Take It Easy, Cardinal Pub & Bar, Stavanger. ABV is 2.7%. Deep golden colour, large white head. Strong aroma of citrussy and catty hops, also notes of pine and crushed gooseberries. Light bodied as expected. The dry flavour is dominated by piney and grapefruity hops throughout. Bitter finish. Maybe not very "well balanced", but tasty and refreshing, and definitely more flavourful than most beers of this strength.

Bottle at Craft Beer Co Brighton. It pours cloudy amber, with a thick white head. The nose is pine, resin, leather, orange and marmalade. The taste is pine, resin, slight metallic, leather, grass and solid bitterness, with a dry finish. Light body and moderate carbonation. Light, fresh and easy drinking.
330ml bottle. Golden/amber color with a small sized off white head. Toasted grains with some citrus. Lighter spiciness.

Bottle. Pours a clear deep gold with a tan head that lasts throughout the beer and laces nicely. Aroma has a good amount of earthy pine with a backing grass note and just a hint of sweet grain. Flavor is similarly hop forward with pine and a bit of resin that mellows in to more of a light grassy note in the finish.
Bottle. Pours hazy gold with a white head. Spicy and earthy hops, a little bit of pine, and a lightly sweet grainy base. Really not that bad for a beer with such a low ABV.

Bottle courtesy blipp! at a tasting at James place.  Pours a hazed ruby grapefruit amber with a thin white head.  Big bright hoppy aromas, citrus and musk.  A bit on the thin side of medium, but full of delicious hops and malt.  Smooth toast leading into a soft bitterness, pungent and earthy.  Nice for a smaller beer.
Draught @ Mikkeller. Cloudy orange gold, white disappearing head. Citrus, hops, fresh pine, spice... but ultimately too thin on the palate and too low in alcohol for it to be pleasant.

Bottle on Session Beer Day and served in a no-nik pint glass: Pours a clean straw hue with an okay fizzy head and spotty lace. The aroma has notes of piney, dank, peppery and citric hops, biscuity malt and some dusty yeast esters. The taste is well, quite bitter and acidic (not very sissy like IMO). Biscuity and dusty background with a touch of clove. The mouth feel is sprite and easy going, thin bodied but then it is a LA beer. For what it is, this beer far exceeded my expectations. Methinks I should have bought more.

33cl bottle @ tasting with Joes and Dutchdrebus. Courtesy of Dutchdrebus. Hazy light orange color, small off-white head. Small yeast particles present. Smell grass after it has just been raining in summer! Very fresh. Taste hops and bitter. A bit watery, but nice and fresh. Medium carbonation, low to medium body.

Bottle from Klooster.  Clear dark golden pour with white head.  Citrus and pine in aroma.  Flavour has same aspects with tropical fruit.  Slightly watery of course due to the low alcohol but amazing flavours for what it is.

Hazy yellow to orange with lots of particles floating around. Decent white head. Smells sweet, thin, hops, melon, seaweed. Tastes a bit thin and watery, also hoppy and fruity. Okay for a low abv, but i like the stronger ones better. Thin body, decent fizzy carbo.

Bottle shared with Linh. Pours a deep, hazy orange amber body with spotty white lacing. Aroma is fresh citrus hop. Mouthfeel is smooth, slightly creamy with notes of fresh, citrus hops. Great low alcohol beer, might bring one of these to my mom. Awesome low alcohol HOP beer.

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2015 Re-rate 8/15: Bottle sample at a tasting at Maxs place. Thanks Stas. Hazy golden. Nice hoppy aroma with tropical fruits and citrus. Dry bitter flavor with citric and piney hops and strong bitterness. Quite light-bodied. 7/3/7/3/14=3.4

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dagans place. Thanks Dror. Slightly hazy golden. Hoppy aroma - piney, grapefruity and a bit floral. Flavor starts a bit grainy and sweetish and continues to a strong lingering bitterness. Rather light-bodied. 7/3/6/3/13=3.2

330ml bottle with 230612 on the cap.  Darker gold, bit of haze, nice off white head that leaves some lacing, and some particles floating around in there.  Bad ass nose!...super pungent with danky tropical fruit hops and light malt underneath although there is a bit of tea in there.  This is a pungent ipa nose and would never guess this is a low alc beer from the smell.  More watery then than I was expecting from the appearance and kind of leaning on the flatter side at first but then has this peppery tight carb finish.  Peppery hop and watery malt flavor up front,  hops are there, but they are like a 95lb 5 chick that looks like she could use a cheeseburger and shake..they just fade so quick and wrap up in a watery steep tea mix of crystal malt and hops.  I kind of nitpicking here a bit since this is a LA beer.  Again, amazing nose and glad to try it, but wouldnt buy again at the price point.  Novelty
bottle at Farmers Cabinet in Philly. blonde pour, citrus pine notes, very drinkable & quite flavorful for a 2.7% beer

Tap. Clear orange, white head. Lots of fresh notes of hops - citrus.. grass, pine and grape. Ultralight body.  Im impressed by this low-alcohol beer. Just dont anything more alcoholic immediately before.

Bottle marked on the cap as 230612. I am assuming that is a cryptic bottling date. Gusher. Pours a hazed golden hue with a lasting, white head that stays. Aromas are grassy, fruity, stone fruits, grapes and currants. Minerally, perfumey and bready. Mild dankness or skunk. Flavors are nutty, grainy, a bit of tannic extracted astringency. Mild hoppy and weed like character. Some fruity esters. Bready malt bill as well (like a marris otter a bit). Some grassiness. Light bodied, dry and fizzy. Would love to try this on tap in warmer weather, seems like it could be slightly faded and out of season.

330. Pours a murky burnished dark orange with a loose white film on top. Spotty lace. Plenty of sharp grapefruit on the nose. Very pungent and fruity, really smells like a real beer. Creamy medium body with lively hop and a very sharp oily hop acid bite. Caramel and loads of grapefruit on the mid palate with a crisp and pithy grapefruit rind finish. Surprising appealing and powerfully flavored.
Bottle @ RBESG Grandtasting 2011... golden amber ... thin white head ... sweet sweet zezty ... little passion fruit nose ... zezty hop ... light bitter ... soft juicy fruits.
Bottle. Small head thin body but Strong honey-fruite aromas. Pleasant dryness with a moderate bitter finish. What a great summerbrew to drink in the Christmas holiday after All the goose fat ect.
Bottle @ RBESG 2011 Grand Tasting at Dean Swift.  Gold/orange with lasting white head.  Hoppy as hell aroma.  Malts dont back up the hops.  Tasty hops, but just a bit too unbalanced.

Last minute pickup to fulfill my Low Alcohol style rate.  Pours copper with fluffy head with visible sediment. Nose is of bitter hops.  Tastes of spruce, cloves, light orange peel, and pretty bitter.  After taste like eating leaves.  There are better ways to stay in shape

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2011 Bottle. Pours cloudy apricot with off white head. Nose is fresh pinapple, citrus, bready caramel malt and malted barley - solid. If I told you it was a a high quality well known hyped IPA and only let you smell it, youd believe me. Davvero un bel prodotto con un notevole equlibrio tra le parti e una beva perfetta che non nega una certa complessità. Corpo esile ma non ci si poteva aspettarsi di più

33cl bottle from DeMolen biershop.
Orangée avec un léger trouble, col fin beige et qcq sédiments de levure.
Arôme est fruité et houblonné rappelant un peu des feuilles de thé bouillies, un beau bouquet houblonné avec en retrait une pointe de malt.
En bouche, le tout est léger vu lalcool mais plein de saveurs houblonnées allant du pamplemousse à dautres agrumes pour une amertume agréable. Sec et fleuri avec un profile malt léger qui est en retrait donnant des notes de cara/pale.
Comme quoi on peut brasser une bonne bière en restant dans une limite alcool.
RBESG August 2011, grand tasting. Golden with a small white head. Strong citrus hop aroma with a touch of elderflower. Dry and hoppy flavour

33 cl bottle. Hazy orange colour with a small white head. Aroma is grapefruits and citrus, weak chocolate. Bitter and fruity taste. Light body - not a big surprise considering the abv. Finished hoppy and with citrus. Impressive taste from 2,7 % alc. Nice beer!

Bottled. Golden coloured. Unclear. Dense beige head. ARoma of sweetness, light pine, some herbs and some flowers and light caramel. Flavour of caramel, light fruits, herbs, some flowers and light pine. MEdium bodied. Ends on a light bitterness. Surprisingly full flavoured for a light ABV beer like this. LIke it.

Pours clear golden orange, with a eggshell white head, Aroma:  Pine, resin, fruity hops, peach, orange peel, tangerine,  bready, light malty. grapefruit,  light mouthfeel  Taste: not surprisingly a bit watery, very dry, crisp, fruity hops, ligh caramel, grapefruit, resin, cantaloupe, orange peel, peach, tangerine,  long bitter aftertaste. mini IPA. the lack of alcohol has been substitutted by loads of hops. Packs a punch considering the low abv.

Bottle at home. Pours a clearish golden with a white head and lacings. Smells of exotic fruity hops. Dry and bitter with citric and piny hops aromas. Light bodied. Medium carbonation. Dry finish with more hops and a touch of malts.

7th August 2011Dean Swift - RBESG Tasting. Hazy amber beer. Little white head. Light crisp palate. Minerally. Good fresh hops, grassy and piney. A little citrus underneath. Bitterish  dry finish. Good flavour for its abv.

Bottle from Bierkoning. Light amber body with puffy head. Nose of citrus and hops. Taste is quite hoppy and pungent. Not too strong, with a little bit of alcohol only, but a nice drink nonetheless. Enjoyable.

Bottle. Im afraid it was not fresh. Herb, salad, piney aroma citrus (not that much). malt (those incredible low alcohol beer...), citric, leaves taste. A random refreshing beer. Could be better but the drinking in the sun is just another story...

330 ml bottle from Høkeren, Copenhagen.
Pours an orange colour with a white thick head. Aroma of strong citrusy hops and some toffee. Flavour of strong citrusy hops, sweet malts and grapefruit. Medium bodied, soft carbonation and a strong, bitter and grapefruity finish. One of the best low alcohol beers Ive tasted and you cant really feel that this is only 2,7% abv.
Hazy amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and rather hoppy - grapefruit and pine needles. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 021011
Bottle @ Autumn Tasting, Ulfborg 2011. Pours cloudy orange with a small off white head. Quite a lot of hops. Pine, grapefruit and citrus. Dry and hoppy. Medium bodied. Good.
Bottle. Hazy amber with medium tan head. Aroma is malt, hop and citrus. Flavour is malt, caramel, fruit, pine, grapefruit, hops and bitter.
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Nice head with good duration. Color is dark golden. Aroma and taste are rich bitter hops, peach, caramel, flowery nose, citrus and malt. Great low alcohol.
Orange colored sissy brew. Nice hopped aroma, not too strong. Flavor has heavy bitterness, harsh, but then soft. Pine, grape. Very flavorfull, decent body and amazing for this low ABV.

Bottle at RBESG 2011 Grand Tasting at The Dean Swift, London. Pours clear gold with a white, foamy head. Great hop aroma. Mild sweet flavor, notes of grass, pine and light grapefruit. Light bodied with fine carbonation. Clear, bitter finish, light toast and citrus. For the ABV - wow! Impressive beer. Pretty damn good no matter what the ABV is, though.

Bottle (RBESG2011, Grand Tasting)
Super fruity grapefruity aroma. Smooth palate, crisp carbonation. Good balance of malts an dhops. Maybe watery, but refreshing. Excellent at the strength.

Bottle 330ml. @ RBESG 11 Grand Tasting at Dean Swift, 10 Gainsford Street, London, England SE1 2NE.Clear medium orange yellow colour with a small to average, fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, moderate to heavy hoppy, pine, spruce, orange - citrus, cat pizz. Flavour is moderate sweet and moderate to heavy bitter with a average to long duration, cat pizz. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20110807]
Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden color wit ha small white head. Has a fruity hoppy citrus aroma. Fruity malty hoppy bitter flavor with a thin mouthfeel. Has a fruity malty hoppy bitter finish.

33 cl bottle from Domus Birrae. Served into an english half pint. Pours a clear pale orange, with an off-white/egg shell colour head. Pungent aroma of resin hops, caramel malts, bubblegum and lots more of resin hops. High bitterness on the tip of the tongue, thin and watery body. Good carbonation. Lots of sweetness in the front of the palate, dry and bitter finish. Kinda an extreme beer, but nice for my taste. A little bit more body would be better tho.

Bottle, bought @ Ølbutikken, Cph.
Pours amberish golden with a small, fizzy, creamy white head. Aroma has good fresh citric hoppiness, grapefruit, peach and pine. Mild doughy caramel base. High carbonation, light watery and dry palate. Flavour is mild, some sweetish malts, but it all about the hops. Citrusy, peachy, grapefruit and quite drying all-the-same. Nice thist-quencher, reminding me of the first Mikkeller Drink in the Sun.
Bottle at home. Aroma of fruity hops, some grass and a little tea. Flavor is nicely bitter, quite hoppy and well balanced. The low abv is hardly noticable. Very drinkable.

Aroma is fruity citrus hops, hint of candy like sweetness, some caramel malt.
Flavour is medium hop bitterness, quite fruity, subtle malt note.
You can taste its low in abv but definitely a good beer.
Draught. High creamy lasting white head. Clear dark amber body. Powerful oranges aroma. A bit sharp hoppy malty fruithy flavor. Low carbonation. Long bitter aftertaste.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar, CopenhagenAmber color, hazy, with a small compact head. It has a nice aroma, fruity at first, resiny a bit later, and finally earthy and grassy (manure). The mouthfeel is of course dry and the body is thin; some caramel flavor, a bit grainy, with light hay too, and black tea; with such beer, the bitterness is just a bit too harsh, and indeed the hop is a bit resiny and dusty, not fruity; the final is strong, as said, harsh.I would not drink much of this even in the summer sun, but I can see the purpose.

Pours cloudy orange with a small white head. Enticing, lively, fruity aroma of hop juice - grapefruits and oranges not the least. Simple, slim medium sweet malt profile and massive layers of hops hits the mouths. Loads of citrusy hops - grapefruit, orangepeel, lemon - some tropical fruits, a little pine and some grassy notes as well. Watery texture, but what the hell, its crisp, its hoppy as hell and the taste is great for such a low ABV. Delightful dry and bitter finish. Gimme Gimme Gimme....

22-AUG-2011, bottle @home, from "Fish & Beer".
Unclear orange with white head.
Very hoppy nose with grape fruit and pine.
Taste is much the same with a spicey note as well.. Thin watery body. Refreshing, but why?
I would still prefer a proper IPA.
Nose is heavy freshbitter hops, sweet rosehip, pine, apricot, feel is mediumweak, carb is medium, taste is bitter hops, gall, weak sour lemon,

Pours copper with a white head. Aroma is fresh limes, cirtus, hops, grassy notes and light pine. Taste is pine, citrus, grapefruit, grass, strong hoppy bitterness, lime and just a hint of malts. This beer is pretty nice if hops are craved in low alcohol situations.
33cl, new exclusive Danish brew Anno 2011, thx to Jeppe!, not complex bitter brew, slightly fruity and malty, balanced, hazy, small head, nice Summer brew
Bottle.Orange colour with medium white head.Aroma is light bitter of citrus also hoppy frésh with crispy  nice flowery mouthfeels,really good taste with only 2.7 alc.

Bottle. Pours a nice orange/copper color with a small white head. Aroma is quite hoppy, with fresh hoppy juice notes, I get grapefruit, citrus, orange with a small amount of sweet matiness. The flavor is also super hoppy with not much malt to speak of, except a sweet maltiness hidden underneath the hops, hopwise I get, grapefruit, grassy notes, citrus, orange and a touch of tropical fruits. The body is really light and almost watery. This beer is quite good for such a low ABV, intensly drinkable, and a good lawnmover beer!

Bottle at RBESG Grand Tasting, held at Dean Swift.
Nice tropical fruit nosemango, passion fruit, peaches. Meaty, with light malt and great hops. Sweet biscuit in the flavor, dry mango, bitter. Thin but very nice for the low abv.

Bottle from Ölbutikken.
Pours dark amber with a white head.
Fresh seducive aroma of citrusy, flowers and a hint of fudge.
Bitter taste of oranges, rather sharp mouthfeel.
Low overall since I think Drinkín the sun and Nanny state are better in this category, despite I love the aroma of this one.
Botella. Hazy golden deep.Pleasant fruity citrus quite hoppy aroma. Good mouthfeel. Fresh hoppy fruity citrus bitter pleasant flavour. Summer brew indeed. Dry and bitter.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours copper with a really nice white head. Though some yeasty chunks, but other than that, nice and clear. Aroma has strong hoppiness, citrus, dried grass, grape fruit, and a dank, vegetal plant-like organic side to the hoppiness. Clearly a lot of hops went into this beer. Only a weak trace of the basic malts. Taste is of course very bitter. Lots of the organic hoppiness I mentioned, actually its like tasting a hop pellet. Really bitter and hoppy. The bitterness is immense, and there is quite some astringency to it, well, it should have considering how fucking hoppy this beer is. Really nice considering the very low abv.

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2011 Pours hazy orange with a lot of sediment OK head. Aroma is hoppy. Body is very thin with a nice bitterness. Thirst quencher, nice low alcohol beer. Re-rate Nov. 4th 2011. Fresh batch, much better! No sediment, more body and much harder to tell that this is a low alcohol beer.
Bottle at home. Clear golden with a small white head. Fruity hops. Citrus and grape. Nice hoppy finish. A very nice summerbeer.

Draught (handpump) at KBH BeerFest 2011 & Bottle at ØLbutikken. Clear golden - white head. Nice fresh hoppy, medium to light malty, citrus, grape fruits, grassy, toasted, light knækbrød, tea, herbal notes. Nice pleasant summerbeer. https://picasaweb.google.com/lh/photo/xFRLiUaHJhSZ
33 cl bottle. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is grapefruity and citrusy. Bitter, fruity and citric. Light bodied. Crisp hoppy and citrusy. Nice and refreshing.

Bottle, pours hazy golden with small white head.... lots hops, citrus, grape, to the nose.... thin body.... sour, bitter hops.... grape finish...
Bottle. Pours hazy golden with a medium white head. The aroma is fruity hoppy with lots of citric notes. The flavour is grape fruit and citric hops and ends up very bitter.

Bottle at Ølbutikken.
